summary: Search for Pokémon by ID or name, with optional filters (height, weight, types, stats) and sorting options.
content:
path: /pokemon/search
method: POST
tags: pokemon, search, filter, sort, id, name
summary: Search for Pokémon by ID or name, with optional filters (height, weight, types, stats) and sorting options.
description: 
parameters: 
requestBody: application/json: {"type":"object","properties":{"searchterm":{"type":"string","description":"Search keyword for Pokémon name or ID."},"filter":{"type":"object","description":"Optional filters for Pokémon search, including height, weight, types, moves, and stats.","properties":{"height":{"type":"object","description":"Filter Pokémon by height range (in decimeters, 10 cm).","properties":{"min":{"type":"integer","description":"Minimum height in decimeters."},"max":{"type":"integer","description":"Maximum height in decimeters."}}},"weight":{"type":"object","description":"Filter Pokémon by weight range (in hectograms, 100 g).","properties":{"min":{"type":"integer","description":"Minimum weight in hectograms."},"max":{"type":"integer","description":"Maximum weight in hectograms."}}},"mustHaveTypes":{"type":"array","description":"List of type IDs that Pokémon must have.","items":{"type":"integer","description":"Type ID."}},"mustNotHaveTypes":{"type":"array","description":"List of type IDs that Pokémon must NOT have.","items":{"type":"integer","description":"Type ID."}},"canLearnMoves":{"type":"array","description":"List of moves (with method) that Pokémon can learn.","items":{"type":"object","properties":{"moveId":{"type":"integer","description":"Move ID."},"moveMethodId":{"type":"integer","description":"Move method ID (e.g., level-up, TM, etc.)."}}}},"stats":{"type":"array","description":"Filter Pokémon by stat ranges.","items":{"type":"object","properties":{"statId":{"type":"integer","description":"Stat ID (e.g., HP, Attack, etc.)."},"min":{"type":"integer","description":"Minimum stat value."},"max":{"type":"integer","description":"Maximum stat value."}}}}}},"page":{"type":"integer","default":0,"description":"Page number for paginated results (default: 0)."},"sortby":{"type":"integer","default":0,"description":"Sorting option for results: 0 (A-Z), 1 (Z-A), 2 (Total stats high-low), 3 (Total stats low-high), 4 (HP high-low), 5 (HP low-high), 6 (Attack high-low), 7 (Attack low-high), 8 (Defense high-low), 9 (Defense low-high), 10 (Special Attack high-low), 11 (Special Attack low-high), 12 (Special Defense high-low), 13 (Special Defense low-high), 14 (Speed high-low), 15 (Speed low-high), 16 (Height high-low), 17 (Height low-high), 18 (Weight high-low), 19 (Weight low-high)."}}}
responses: 200: Pokémon details retrieved {"type":"object","properties":{"results":{"type":"array","description":"List of Pokémon matching the search criteria.","items":{"type":"object","properties":{"id":{"type":"number","description":"Pokémon ID. Unique identifier for the Pokémon."},"name":{"type":"string","description":"Pokémon name. The English name of the Pokémon."},"type":{"type":"string","description":"Primary type of the Pokémon. For example: 'Fire', 'Water', etc."},"abilities":{"type":"array","description":"List of ability names for the Pokémon. Each ability describes a special trait or power.","items":{"type":"string","description":"Ability name. For example: 'Overgrow', 'Blaze', etc."}},"sprite":{"type":"string","description":"URL to the Pokémon sprite image. This is a direct link to the official artwork.","example":"https://raw.githubusercontent.com/PokeAPI/sprites/master/sprites/pokemon/{id}.png"}}}},"totalCount":{"type":"integer","description":"Total number of Pokémon found. Indicates the total number of results matching the search criteria."},"totalPage":{"type":"integer","description":"Total number of pages for paginated results. Calculated based on totalCount and page size."}}}; 404: Pokémon not found

summary: Search for Pokémon moves by ID or name, with optional filters (type, power, pp, damage class, priority) and ordering.
content:
path: /pokemon/move/search
method: POST
tags: pokemon, move, search, filter, order, id, name
summary: Search for Pokémon moves by ID or name, with optional filters (type, power, pp, damage class, priority) and ordering.
description: 
parameters: 
requestBody: application/json: {"type":"object","properties":{"searchterm":{"type":"string","description":"Search keyword for move name or ID."},"page":{"type":"integer","default":0,"description":"Page number for paginated results (default: 0)."},"filters":{"type":"object","description":"Optional filters for move search, including type, power, PP, damage class, and priority.","properties":{"type":{"type":"integer","description":"Filter by move type ID (e.g., 1 for Normal, 10 for Fire)."},"power":{"type":"object","description":"Filter moves by power range. Power indicates the base damage of the move.","properties":{"min":{"type":"integer","description":"Minimum power value."},"max":{"type":"integer","description":"Maximum power value."}}},"pp":{"type":"object","description":"Filter moves by PP (Power Points) range. PP indicates how many times a move can be used.","properties":{"min":{"type":"integer","description":"Minimum PP value."},"max":{"type":"integer","description":"Maximum PP value."}}},"damageClass":{"type":"integer","description":"Filter by damage class ID: 1 for status moves, 2 for physical moves, 3 for special moves."},"priority":{"type":"object","description":"Filter moves by priority range. Priority determines move order in battle (higher priority moves go first).","properties":{"min":{"type":"integer","description":"Minimum priority value (can be negative)."},"max":{"type":"integer","description":"Maximum priority value."}}}}},"order":{"type":"integer","default":0,"description":"Ordering options: 0 (A-Z), 1 (Z-A), 2 (Power high-low), 3 (Power low-high), 4 (PP high-low), 5 (PP low-high), 6 (Accuracy high-low), 7 (Accuracy low-high)"}}}
responses: 200: Move details retrieved {"type":"object","properties":{"results":{"type":"array","description":"List of moves matching the search criteria.","items":{"type":"object","properties":{"id":{"type":"number","description":"Unique move ID."},"identifier":{"type":"string","description":"Move identifier (internal name in lowercase with hyphens)."},"type_id":{"type":"number","description":"Type ID of the move (e.g., 1 for Normal, 10 for Fire)."},"type_name":{"type":"string","description":"Localized name of the move's type."},"power":{"type":"integer","description":"Base power/damage of the move. Null for status moves."},"pp":{"type":"integer","description":"Power Points - the number of times this move can be used."},"accuracy":{"type":"integer","description":"Move accuracy as a percentage (0-100). Null for moves that never miss."},"priority":{"type":"integer","description":"Priority level in battle. Higher values move first. Range typically -7 to +5."},"damage_class_id":{"type":"number","description":"Damage class ID: 1 (status), 2 (physical), 3 (special)."},"damage_class_name":{"type":"string","description":"Localized name of the damage class (e.g., 'Physical', 'Special', 'Status')."},"localized_name":{"type":"string","description":"Localized/translated name of the move in the user's language."}}}},"totalCount":{"type":"integer","description":"Total number of moves found matching the criteria."},"totalPage":{"type":"integer","description":"Total number of pages available for pagination."}}}; 404: Move not found

summary: Search for Pokémon abilities by ID or name.
description: 
parameters: 
requestBody: application/json: {"type":"object","properties":{"searchterm":{"type":"string","description":"Search keyword for ability name or ID."},"page":{"type":"integer","default":0,"description":"Page number for paginated results (default: 0)."}}}
responses: 200: Ability details retrieved {"type":"object","properties":{"results":{"type":"array","description":"List of Pokémon abilities matching the search criteria.","items":{"type":"object","properties":{"id":{"type":"number","description":"Unique ability ID."},"name":{"type":"string","description":"Localized name of the ability."},"effect":{"type":"string","description":"Detailed description of the ability's effect in battle and outside of battle."}}}},"totalCount":{"type":"integer","description":"Total number of abilities found matching the criteria."},"totalPage":{"type":"integer","description":"Total number of pages available for pagination."}}}; 404: Ability not found

False indicates the entry is active."},"identifier":{"type":"string","description":"Pokémon identifier (internal name in lowercase with hyphens)."},"height":{"type":"integer","description":"Height of the Pokémon in decimeters (10 cm)."},"weight":{"type":"integer","description":"Weight of the Pokémon in hectograms (100 g)."},"total_stats":{"type":"integer","description":"Sum of all base stats (HP + Attack + Defense + Special Attack + Special Defense + Speed)."},"hp":{"type":"integer","description":"Base HP (Hit Points) stat value."},"attack":{"type":"integer","description":"Base Attack stat value."},"defense":{"type":"integer","description":"Base Defense stat value."},"special_attack":{"type":"integer","description":"Base Special Attack stat value."},"special_defense":{"type":"integer","description":"Base Special Defense stat value."},"speed":{"type":"integer","description":"Base Speed stat value."},"types":{"type":"array","description":"List of types the Pokémon has (e.g., Fire, Water, Grass).","items":{"type":"object","properties":{"type":{"type":"string","description":"Type identifier."},"type_name":{"type":"string","description":"Localized type name."}}}},"sprite":{"type":"string","format":"url","description":"URL to the Pokémon's sprite image."}}}}

of the Pokémon."},"identifier":{"type":"string","description":"Pokémon identifier (internal name in lowercase with hyphens)."},"order":{"type":"integer","description":"Order index for sorting (matches National Pokédex order)."},"height":{"type":"integer","description":"Height of the Pokémon in decimeters (10 cm)."},"weight":{"type":"integer","description":"Weight of the Pokémon in hectograms (100 g)."},"baseExperience":{"type":"integer","description":"Base experience points gained when defeating this Pokémon."},"flavorText":{"type":"string","description":"Pokédex flavor text / description of the Pokémon."},"speciesId":{"type":"integer","description":"ID of the Pokémon species."},"speciesName":{"type":"string","description":"Name of the Pokémon species."},"isDefault":{"type":"boolean","description":"Whether this is the default form of the species."},"totalStats":{"type":"string","description":"Sum of all base stats as a Defense stat value."},"speed":{"type":"integer","description":"Base Speed stat value."},"specialAttack":{"type":"integer","description":"Base Special Attack stat value."},"specialDefense":{"type":"integer","description":"Base Special Defense stat value."},"types":{"type":"array","description":"List of types the Pokémon has (primary and secondary name."}}}},"pokemonTypeNames":{"type":"array","description":"Array of type names as strings (e.g., ['Fire', 'Flying']).","items":{"type":"string","description":"Type name."}},"abilities":{"type":"array","description":"List of abilities the Pokémon can have.","items":{"type":"object","properties":{"ability":{"type":"string","description":"Ability identifier."},"ability_name":{"type":"string","description":"Localized ability name."}}}},"moves":{"type":"array","description":"List of moves the Pokémon can learn, with details about each Null for moves that never miss."},"pp":{"type":"integer","description":"Power Points - number of times the move can be used."},"priority":{"type":"integer","description":"Priority level in battle. Higher values move first."},"name":{"type":"string","description":"Localized move name."},"move_method":{"type":"string","description":"How the Pokémon learns this move (e.g., 'level-up', 'machine', 'tutor')."},"level":{"type":"integer","description":"Level at which the move is learned (for level-up moves). Null for other learn methods."},"type":{"type":"string","description":"Type name of the move."}}}},"sprite":{"type":"string","description":"URL to the Pokémon's sprite image.","example":"https://raw.githubusercontent.com/PokeAPI/sprites/master/sprites/pokemon/{id}.png"}}}; 404: Pokémon not found

Null for status moves."},"accuracy":{"type":"integer","description":"Accuracy percentage (0-100). Null for moves that never miss."},"pp":{"type":"integer","description":"Power Points - number of times the move can be used."},"priority":{"type":"integer","description":"Priority level in battle. Higher values move first."},"name":{"type":"string","description":"Localized move name."},"move_method":{"type":"string","description":"How the Pokémon learns this move (e.g., 'level-up', 'machine', 'tutor')."},"level":{"type":"integer","description":"Level at which the move is learned (for level-up moves). Null for other learn methods."}}}},"page":{"type":"integer","description":"Current page number."},"limit":{"type":"integer","description":"Number of results per page."},"totalPages":{"type":"integer","description":"Total number of pages available."}}}; 400: Invalid request parameters; 404: Pokémon or moves not found

Database Schema:
Tables:
UserPokemonTeamMembers(id, team_id, pokemon_id, nickname, level, order_index, moves, shiny, deleted, created_at, created_by, updated_at, updated_by)

-- Example 1
Question: Show all pokemon in team 10 ordered by position.
SQL: SELECT pokemon_id, nickname, level, shiny
FROM UserPokemonTeamMembers
WHERE team_id = 10 AND deleted = FALSE
ORDER BY order_index;

-- Example 2
Question: Find all shiny pokemon across all teams.
SQL: SELECT tm.team_id, t.team_name, tm.pokemon_id, tm.nickname
FROM UserPokemonTeamMembers tm
JOIN UserPokemonTeams t ON tm.team_id = t.id
WHERE tm.shiny = TRUE AND tm.deleted = FALSE AND t.deleted = FALSE
ORDER BY t.team_name, tm.order_index;

Database Schema:
Tables:
UserPokemonTeams(id, user_id, team_name, deleted, created_at, created_by, updated_at, updated_by)

-- Example 1
Question: List all teams created by user 3.
SQL: SELECT id, team_name, created_at
FROM UserPokemonTeams
WHERE user_id = 3 AND deleted = FALSE
ORDER BY created_at DESC;

-- Example 2
Question: Find teams with names containing "Fire".
SQL: SELECT id, user_id, team_name
FROM UserPokemonTeams
WHERE team_name ILIKE '%Fire%' AND deleted = FALSE
ORDER BY team_name;

Database Schema:
Tables:
UserPokemonWatchlist(id, pokemon_id, user_id, deleted, created_at, created_by, updated_at, updated_by)

-- Example 1
Question: List all pokemon in user 5's watchlist.
SQL: SELECT pokemon_id
FROM UserPokemonWatchlist
WHERE user_id = 5 AND deleted = FALSE
ORDER BY created_at DESC;

-- Example 2
Question: Find users watching pikachu (pokemon_id = 25).
SQL: SELECT DISTINCT user_id
FROM UserPokemonWatchlist
WHERE pokemon_id = 25 AND deleted = FALSE
ORDER BY user_id;

Database Schema:
Tables:
abilities(id, identifier, generation_id, is_main_series)

-- Example 1
Question: Show abilities introduced in generation 5 or later.
SQL: SELECT a.identifier, g.identifier as generation
FROM abilities a
JOIN generations g ON a.generation_id = g.id
WHERE a.generation_id >= 5
ORDER BY a.generation_id, a.identifier;

-- Example 2
Question: Which ability is shared by the most pokemon?
SQL: SELECT a.identifier, COUNT(DISTINCT pa.pokemon_id) as pokemon_count
FROM abilities a
JOIN pokemon_abilities pa ON a.id = pa.ability_id
GROUP BY a.id, a.identifier
ORDER BY pokemon_count DESC
LIMIT 10;

Database Schema:
Tables:
ability_names(ability_id, local_language_id, name)

-- Example 1
Question: Find abilities with localized names in English (language_id = 9).
SQL: SELECT a.identifier, an.name as english_name
FROM abilities a
JOIN ability_names an ON a.id = an.ability_id
WHERE an.local_language_id = 9
ORDER BY a.identifier;

-- Example 2
Question: List abilities with their names in multiple languages.
SQL: SELECT a.identifier, COUNT(DISTINCT an.local_language_id) as language_count
FROM abilities a
JOIN ability_names an ON a.id = an.ability_id
GROUP BY a.id, a.identifier
ORDER BY language_count DESC;

Database Schema:
Tables:
contest_types(id, identifier)

-- Example 1
Question: List all contest types with berry flavor associations.
SQL: SELECT ct.identifier, COUNT(DISTINCT bf.berry_id) as berry_count
FROM contest_types ct
LEFT JOIN berry_flavors bf ON ct.id = bf.contest_type_id
GROUP BY ct.id, ct.identifier
ORDER BY berry_count DESC;

-- Example 2
Question: Find moves associated with each contest type.
SQL: SELECT ct.identifier as contest_type, COUNT(*) as move_count
FROM contest_types ct
LEFT JOIN moves m ON ct.id = m.contest_type_id
GROUP BY ct.id, ct.identifier
ORDER BY move_count DESC;

Database Schema:
Tables:
generations(id, main_region_id, identifier)

-- Example 1
Question: How many pokemon were introduced in each generation?
SQL: SELECT g.identifier as generation, COUNT(DISTINCT ps.id) as pokemon_count
FROM generations g
LEFT JOIN pokemon_species ps ON g.id = ps.generation_id
GROUP BY g.id, g.identifier
ORDER BY g.id;

-- Example 2
Question: Count the number of abilities introduced per generation.
SQL: SELECT g.identifier as generation, COUNT(*) as ability_count
FROM generations g
LEFT JOIN abilities a ON g.id = a.generation_id
GROUP BY g.id, g.identifier
ORDER BY g.id;

Database Schema:
Tables:
language_names(id, language_id, local_language_id, name)

-- Example 1
Question: Get language names in English (local_language_id = 9).
SQL: SELECT l.identifier, ln.name as english_name
FROM languages l
JOIN language_names ln ON l.id = ln.language_id
WHERE ln.local_language_id = 9
ORDER BY l.identifier;

-- Example 2
Question: Find how many localized names each language has.
SQL: SELECT l.identifier, COUNT(*) as translation_count
FROM languages l
JOIN language_names ln ON l.id = ln.language_id
GROUP BY l.id, l.identifier
ORDER BY translation_count DESC;

Database Schema:
Tables:
languages(id, iso639, iso3166, identifier, official, order)

-- Example 1
Question: List all official languages.
SQL: SELECT identifier, iso639, iso3166
FROM languages
WHERE official = TRUE
ORDER BY "order";

-- Example 2
Question: Find languages used in Japan.
SQL: SELECT identifier, iso639
FROM languages
WHERE iso3166 = 'jp'
ORDER BY "order";

Database Schema:
Tables:
move_damage_classes(id, identifier)

-- Example 1
Question: List all status moves (moves with no power).
SQL: SELECT m.identifier
FROM moves m
JOIN move_damage_classes mdc ON m.damage_class_id = mdc.id
WHERE mdc.identifier = 'status'
ORDER BY m.identifier;

-- Example 2
Question: List all move damage classes with example moves.
SQL: SELECT mdc.identifier as damage_class, COUNT(*) as move_count
FROM move_damage_classes mdc
LEFT JOIN moves m ON mdc.id = m.damage_class_id
GROUP BY mdc.id, mdc.identifier
ORDER BY move_count DESC;

Database Schema:
Tables:
move_targets(id, identifier)

-- Example 1
Question: Show the distribution of moves across different target types.
SQL: SELECT mt.identifier as target_type, COUNT(*) as move_count
FROM move_targets mt
LEFT JOIN moves m ON mt.id = m.target_id
GROUP BY mt.id, mt.identifier
ORDER BY move_count DESC;

-- Example 2
Question: Find powerful moves that target all opponents.
SQL: SELECT m.identifier, m.power
FROM moves m
JOIN move_targets mt ON m.target_id = mt.id
WHERE mt.identifier = 'all-opponents' AND m.power IS NOT NULL
ORDER BY m.power DESC
LIMIT 10;

Database Schema:
Tables:
moves(id, identifier, generation_id, type_id, power, pp, accuracy, priority, target_id, damage_class_id, effect_id, effect_chance, contest_type_id, contest_effect_id, super_contest_effect_id)

-- Example 1
Question: Find the most powerful fire-type moves.
SQL: SELECT m.identifier, m.power, m.accuracy
FROM moves m
JOIN types t ON m.type_id = t.id
WHERE t.identifier = 'fire' AND m.power IS NOT NULL
ORDER BY m.power DESC
LIMIT 10;

-- Example 2
Question: Find moves with 100% accuracy and power greater than 80.
SQL: SELECT m.identifier, m.power, t.identifier as type
FROM moves m
JOIN types t ON m.type_id = t.id
WHERE m.accuracy = 100 AND m.power > 80
ORDER BY m.power DESC;

Database Schema:
Tables:
pokemon(id, identifier, species_id, height, weight, base_experience, order, is_default)

-- Example 1
Question: Show pokemon that weigh more than 2000 hectograms.
SQL: SELECT identifier, weight
FROM pokemon
WHERE weight > 2000
ORDER BY weight DESC;

-- Example 2
Question: Find the default form for each pokemon species.
SQL: SELECT p.identifier, p.height, p.weight
FROM pokemon p
WHERE p.is_default = TRUE
ORDER BY p.identifier;

Database Schema:
Tables:
pokemon_abilities(id, pokemon_id, ability_id, is_hidden, slot)

-- Example 1
Question: List all abilities available to pikachu.
SQL: SELECT a.identifier, pa.is_hidden
FROM pokemon p
JOIN pokemon_abilities pa ON p.id = pa.pokemon_id
JOIN abilities a ON pa.ability_id = a.id
WHERE p.identifier = 'pikachu'
ORDER BY pa.slot;

-- Example 2
Question: Find hidden abilities for fire-type pokemon.
SQL: SELECT DISTINCT p.identifier as pokemon, a.identifier as ability
FROM pokemon p
JOIN pokemon_types pt ON p.id = pt.pokemon_id
JOIN types t ON pt.type_id = t.id
JOIN pokemon_abilities pa ON p.id = pa.pokemon_id
JOIN abilities a ON pa.ability_id = a.id
WHERE t.identifier = 'fire' AND pa.is_hidden = TRUE
ORDER BY p.identifier;

Database Schema:
Tables:
pokemon_move_methods(id, identifier)

-- Example 1
Question: List all move learning methods with move counts.
SQL: SELECT pmm.identifier as method, COUNT(DISTINCT pm.move_id) as move_count
FROM pokemon_move_methods pmm
LEFT JOIN pokemon_moves pm ON pmm.id = pm.move_method_id
GROUP BY pmm.id, pmm.identifier
ORDER BY move_count DESC;

-- Example 2
Question: Find moves that pikachu learns by leveling up.
SQL: SELECT m.identifier, pm.level
FROM pokemon p
JOIN pokemon_moves pm ON p.id = pm.pokemon_id
JOIN moves m ON pm.move_id = m.id
JOIN pokemon_move_methods pmm ON pm.move_method_id = pmm.id
WHERE p.identifier = 'pikachu' AND pmm.identifier = 'level-up'
ORDER BY pm.level;

Database Schema:
Tables:
pokemon_moves(id, pokemon_id, move_id, version_group_id, move_method_id, level, order_index, mastery)

-- Example 1
Question: What moves can pikachu learn?
SQL: SELECT m.identifier, pmm.identifier as learn_method, pm.level
FROM pokemon p
JOIN pokemon_moves pm ON p.id = pm.pokemon_id
JOIN moves m ON pm.move_id = m.id
JOIN pokemon_move_methods pmm ON pm.move_method_id = pmm.id
WHERE p.identifier = 'pikachu'
ORDER BY pm.level, m.identifier;

-- Example 2
Question: What are the most common moves learned by water-type pokemon?
SQL: SELECT m.identifier, COUNT(DISTINCT p.id) as pokemon_count
FROM moves m
JOIN pokemon_moves pm ON m.id = pm.move_id
JOIN pokemon p ON pm.pokemon_id = p.id
JOIN pokemon_types pt ON p.id = pt.pokemon_id
JOIN types t ON pt.type_id = t.id
WHERE t.identifier = 'water'
GROUP BY m.id, m.identifier
ORDER BY pokemon_count DESC
LIMIT 15;

Database Schema:
Tables:
pokemon_species(id, identifier, generation_id, evolves_from_species_id, evolution_chain_id, color_id, shape_id, habitat_id, gender_rate, capture_rate, base_happiness, is_baby, hatch_counter, has_gender_differences, growth_rate_id, forms_switchable, is_legendary, is_mythical, order, conquest_order)

-- Example 1
Question: List all legendary pokemon.
SQL: SELECT identifier
FROM pokemon_species
WHERE is_legendary = TRUE
ORDER BY identifier;

-- Example 2
Question: Find pokemon that evolve from pikachu.
SQL: SELECT ps.identifier
FROM pokemon_species ps
JOIN pokemon_species parent ON ps.evolves_from_species_id = parent.id
WHERE parent.identifier = 'pikachu';

Database Schema:
Tables:
pokemon_stats(pokemon_id, stat_id, base_stat, effort)

-- Example 1
Question: Find me the strongest fire-type pokemon.
SQL: SELECT p.identifier, SUM(ps.base_stat) as total_stats
FROM pokemon p
JOIN pokemon_types pt ON p.id = pt.pokemon_id
JOIN types t ON pt.type_id = t.id
JOIN pokemon_stats ps ON p.id = ps.pokemon_id
WHERE t.identifier = 'fire'
GROUP BY p.id, p.identifier
ORDER BY total_stats DESC
LIMIT 1;

-- Example 2
Question: What's the lowest attack a grass-type pokemon can have?
SQL: SELECT MIN(ps.base_stat) as min_attack
FROM pokemon p
JOIN pokemon_types pt ON p.id = pt.pokemon_id
JOIN types t ON pt.type_id = t.id
JOIN pokemon_stats ps ON p.id = ps.pokemon_id
JOIN stats s ON ps.stat_id = s.id
WHERE t.identifier = 'grass' AND s.identifier = 'attack';

Database Schema:
Tables:
pokemon_types(pokemon_id, type_id, slot)

-- Example 1
Question: Find all fire-type pokemon.
SQL: SELECT p.identifier
FROM pokemon p
JOIN pokemon_types pt ON p.id = pt.pokemon_id
JOIN types t ON pt.type_id = t.id
WHERE t.identifier = 'fire'
ORDER BY p.identifier;

-- Example 2
Question: Find dual-type pokemon (pokemon with exactly 2 types).
SQL: SELECT p.identifier
FROM pokemon p
JOIN pokemon_types pt ON p.id = pt.pokemon_id
GROUP BY p.id, p.identifier
HAVING COUNT(*) = 2
ORDER BY p.identifier;

Database Schema:
Tables:
customer(id, name, city)

-- Example 1
Question: List all customers.
SQL: SELECT name FROM customer;

-- Example 2
Question: Show customer names with order amounts over 100.
SQL: SELECT c.name
FROM customer c
JOIN orders o ON c.id = o.customer_id
WHERE o.amount > 100;

Database Schema:
Tables:
stats(id, damage_class_id, identifier, is_battle_only, game_index)

-- Example 1
Question: Show all battle stats (non-battle-only stats).
SQL: SELECT identifier
FROM stats
WHERE is_battle_only = FALSE
ORDER BY game_index;

-- Example 2
Question: Find which damage classes are associated with which stats.
SQL: SELECT s.identifier as stat, mdc.identifier as damage_class
FROM stats s
LEFT JOIN move_damage_classes mdc ON s.damage_class_id = mdc.id
WHERE s.damage_class_id IS NOT NULL
ORDER BY s.identifier;

Database Schema:
Tables:
types(id, identifier, generation_id, damage_class_id)

-- Example 1
Question: List all pokemon types.
SQL: SELECT identifier
FROM types
ORDER BY identifier;

-- Example 2
Question: Find types introduced in each generation.
SQL: SELECT g.identifier as generation, t.identifier as type
FROM generations g
JOIN types t ON g.id = t.generation_id
ORDER BY g.id, t.identifier;
